poem:
Title: "In the Chambers Unsettled"

Sunak's tune is 
a Tory-tumbled mess,
fault lines - laughter's echo.
Elphicke's unlikely ballet
across political divide.

Mordaunt's pledge 
like ripe plums,
sweet on the tongue
of the Commons,
Promising no defection.

The politics, a crimson confusion,
Ripe for picking. Pity.
For the world unfolds
In the fruit's soft press,
In the chambers unsettled.
Underneath, a turmoil
ripe and riddled.
